pullRequest.title: Port Batch common test project and jbatch_fat to open-liberty
pullRequest.bodyText:
-Moves com.ibm.wsjbatch.test.dbservlet project to dir com.ibm.ws.jbatch.common_fat
-Moves com.ibm.ws.jbatch_fat to com.ibm.ws.jbatch.open_fat
-Adds gradle targets to common_fat that build app archives
-Adds app utility class to common_fat that shrinkwraps and deploys app archives
-Adds gradle targets to open_fat to import sources and app archives from common_fat
-Enables open_fat to build common (shared) and local test archives locally
-Modifies all open_fat test classes to hot-deploy required app archives
-Repeats open_fat for ee9, only

nodes.bodyText:
From @cgianfra:  Do we need these gradle tasks still, since you added the BatchAppUtils methods to build them at test execution time?
I provided gradle build targets for the common_fat app archives, along with the corresponding deployment support in BatchAppUtils.java, to afford options in future jbatch work.  If, for example, you work another jbatch FAT project where importing+compiling the common_fat classes is problematic, you can opt to use the prebuilt archives.   The prebuilt archive support is otherwise vestigial and can be removed if you intend to standardize open-liberty jbatch FAT projects to use shrinkwrap during test execution.
